title: (x) Pixel font from Group94 website - Supermonomarket, Stansharp {James}
content:
Hello.   
   
I am trying to find a match to the attached pixel font, the font image is taken from the Group94 site.   
   
I have looked at all the major screen font sites (Atomic Media, FFF, Pixietype, Ultrafonts etc.) but have had no luck. The closest match so far is Craig Kroeger's (miniml.com): Standard 09\_56, which has a similar l/c 'a', not quite the same height though.   
   
If anyone had any leads, it would be much appreciated.   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100309133923im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/41477.jpg)
author: Jem

comments.content: I spent more time than I liked staring at the 29 pages of bitmapped fonts on DaFont without finding an exact match. The closest were 'Petit' by Clops and 'Rix' by Enrico. The other direction I went was to look at Emigr

Thank you very much Mike, I forgot about Emigre and had not heard of DaFont.   
   
And yes i know what you mean, staring at minature pixel fonts for hours on end is a good way to go blind.
I think there's a bunch of links [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20100309133923/http:/bmap.info/) to lotsa bitmap sites.

that looks like something from either FFF or miniml ...   
   
fontsforflash.com   
miniml.com

\> _fontsforflash.com_   
\> _miniml.com_   
   
Nope. Neither. Nor. Checked both these yesterday...   
   
Still looking.

oops/doh! Jeremy mentioned FFF and miniml in his   
initial post.   
   
"we read least what we see first"

This was mentioned a couple of months ago. The fonts seem to be Supermonomarket, and stansharp. You can check [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20100309133923/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/33518.html?1082425217) for more information.

James you are a genuine Archive Meister! THX for making   
my life easier. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20100309133923im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

Hello,  
the last link doesn't work, it's some days that i'm looking for that pixel font. I don't find any font on the web named supermonomarket!  
May you help me, thank you,  
enrico
You'll find what James Gareth had to say about the Group94 pixel fonts in [this thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20100309133923/http:/typophile.com/node/9804).

Thanks Bald for the answer.  
i didn't find the font so i decided to draw it from zero.  
If anyone need that i'm glad to share it. I tryied also to export it as a superpixelfont and it's pretty nice.  
ciao,  
enrico

i'd love to have that font, would you mind sending it to me?

thanks!
would be great if you also don't mind sending it to me too. many thanks!
